meta.article_title: February 21, 2011 - Wait a split second longer when looping a push, then change directions

causes_communes: Most blockers develop timing to react to your normal loop

debutant: Wait a split second longer than normal, letting the ball travel perhaps an six inches to a foot, and then go down the line
Make no attempt to hide your setup to loop crosscourt

exercices_complementaires.description: Set up to loop crosscourt, wait a split second longer than normal, then go down the line. Focus on the timing and delay.

metriques_progression: Target: 6-12 inches ball travel before changing direction
erreurs_a_eviter: Don't try to hide your setup, as this can be detected by the opponent
